speaker: SIR HUGH EVANS
text_entry: SCENE V. Another part of the Park.

speaker: SIR HUGH EVANS
text_entry: Enter FALSTAFF disguised as Herne

speaker: FALSTAFF
text_entry: The Windsor bell hath struck twelve; the minute

speaker: FALSTAFF
text_entry: draws on. Now, the hot-blooded gods assist me!

speaker: FALSTAFF
text_entry: Remember, Jove, thou wast a bull for thy Europa; love

speaker: FALSTAFF
text_entry: set on thy horns. O powerful love! that, in some

speaker: FALSTAFF
text_entry: respects, makes a beast a man, in some other, a man

speaker: FALSTAFF
text_entry: a beast. You were also, Jupiter, a swan for the love

speaker: FALSTAFF
text_entry: of Leda. O omnipotent Love! how near the god drew

speaker: FALSTAFF
text_entry: to the complexion of a goose! A fault done first in

speaker: FALSTAFF
text_entry: the form of a beast. O Jove, a beastly fault! And

speaker: FALSTAFF
text_entry: then another fault in the semblance of a fowl; think

speaker: FALSTAFF
text_entry: on 't, Jove; a foul fault! When gods have hot

speaker: FALSTAFF
text_entry: backs, what shall poor men do? For me, I am here a

speaker: FALSTAFF
text_entry: Windsor stag; and the fattest, I think, i' the

speaker: FALSTAFF
text_entry: forest. Send me a cool rut-time, Jove, or who can

speaker: FALSTAFF
text_entry: blame me to piss my tallow? Who comes here? my

speaker: FALSTAFF
text_entry: doe?

speaker: FALSTAFF
text_entry: Enter MISTRESS FORD and MISTRESS PAGE

speaker: MISTRESS FORD
text_entry: Sir John! art thou there, my deer? my male deer?

speaker: FALSTAFF
text_entry: My doe with the black scut! Let the sky rain

speaker: FALSTAFF
text_entry: potatoes; let it thunder to the tune of Green

speaker: FALSTAFF
text_entry: Sleeves, hail kissing-comfits and snow eringoes; let

speaker: FALSTAFF
text_entry: there come a tempest of provocation, I will shelter me here.

speaker: MISTRESS FORD
text_entry: Mistress Page is come with me, sweetheart.

speaker: FALSTAFF
text_entry: Divide me like a bribe buck, each a haunch: I will

speaker: FALSTAFF
text_entry: keep my sides to myself, my shoulders for the fellow

speaker: FALSTAFF
text_entry: of this walk, and my horns I bequeath your husbands.

speaker: FALSTAFF
text_entry: Am I a woodman, ha? Speak I like Herne the hunter?

speaker: FALSTAFF
text_entry: Why, now is Cupid a child of conscience; he makes

speaker: FALSTAFF
text_entry: restitution. As I am a true spirit, welcome!

speaker: FALSTAFF
text_entry: Noise within

speaker: MISTRESS PAGE
text_entry: Alas, what noise?

speaker: MISTRESS FORD
text_entry: Heaven forgive our sins

speaker: FALSTAFF
text_entry: What should this be?

speaker: MISTRESS PAGE
text_entry: Away, away!

speaker: MISTRESS PAGE
text_entry: They run off

speaker: FALSTAFF
text_entry: I think the devil will not have me damned, lest the

speaker: FALSTAFF
text_entry: oil that's in me should set hell on fire; he would

speaker: FALSTAFF
text_entry: never else cross me thus.

speaker: FALSTAFF
text_entry: Enter SIR HUGH EVANS, disguised as before; PISTOL,  as Hobgoblin; MISTRESS QUICKLY, ANNE PAGE, and others, as Fairies, with tapers

speaker: MISTRESS QUICKLY
text_entry: Fairies, black, grey, green, and white,

speaker: MISTRESS QUICKLY
text_entry: You moonshine revellers and shades of night,

speaker: MISTRESS QUICKLY
text_entry: You orphan heirs of fixed destiny,

speaker: MISTRESS QUICKLY
text_entry: Attend your office and your quality.

speaker: MISTRESS QUICKLY
text_entry: Crier Hobgoblin, make the fairy oyes.

speaker: PISTOL
text_entry: Elves, list your names; silence, you airy toys.

speaker: PISTOL
text_entry: Cricket, to Windsor chimneys shalt thou leap:

speaker: PISTOL
text_entry: Where fires thou find'st unraked and hearths unswept,

speaker: PISTOL
text_entry: There pinch the maids as blue as bilberry:

speaker: PISTOL
text_entry: Our radiant queen hates sluts and sluttery.

speaker: FALSTAFF
text_entry: They are fairies; he that speaks to them shall die:

speaker: FALSTAFF
text_entry: I'll wink and couch: no man their works must eye.

speaker: FALSTAFF
text_entry: Lies down upon his face

speaker: SIR HUGH EVANS
text_entry: Where's Bede? Go you, and where you find a maid

speaker: SIR HUGH EVANS
text_entry: That, ere she sleep, has thrice her prayers said,

speaker: SIR HUGH EVANS
text_entry: Raise up the organs of her fantasy;

speaker: SIR HUGH EVANS
text_entry: Sleep she as sound as careless infancy:

speaker: SIR HUGH EVANS
text_entry: But those as sleep and think not on their sins,

speaker: SIR HUGH EVANS
text_entry: Pinch them, arms, legs, backs, shoulders, sides and shins.

speaker: MISTRESS QUICKLY
text_entry: About, about;

speaker: MISTRESS QUICKLY
text_entry: Search Windsor Castle, elves, within and out:

speaker: MISTRESS QUICKLY
text_entry: Strew good luck, ouphes, on every sacred room:

speaker: MISTRESS QUICKLY
text_entry: That it may stand till the perpetual doom,

speaker: MISTRESS QUICKLY
text_entry: In state as wholesome as in state 'tis fit,

speaker: MISTRESS QUICKLY
text_entry: Worthy the owner, and the owner it.

speaker: MISTRESS QUICKLY
text_entry: The several chairs of order look you scour

speaker: MISTRESS QUICKLY
text_entry: With juice of balm and every precious flower:

speaker: MISTRESS QUICKLY
text_entry: Each fair instalment, coat, and several crest,

speaker: MISTRESS QUICKLY
text_entry: With loyal blazon, evermore be blest!

speaker: MISTRESS QUICKLY
text_entry: And nightly, meadow-fairies, look you sing,

speaker: MISTRESS QUICKLY
text_entry: Like to the Garter's compass, in a ring:

speaker: MISTRESS QUICKLY
text_entry: The expressure that it bears, green let it be,

speaker: MISTRESS QUICKLY
text_entry: More fertile-fresh than all the field to see;

speaker: MISTRESS QUICKLY
text_entry: And 'Honi soit qui mal y pense' write

speaker: MISTRESS QUICKLY
text_entry: In emerald tufts, flowers purple, blue and white;

speaker: MISTRESS QUICKLY
text_entry: Let sapphire, pearl and rich embroidery,

speaker: MISTRESS QUICKLY
text_entry: Buckled below fair knighthood's bending knee:

speaker: MISTRESS QUICKLY
text_entry: Fairies use flowers for their charactery.

speaker: MISTRESS QUICKLY
text_entry: Away; disperse: but till 'tis one o'clock,

speaker: MISTRESS QUICKLY
text_entry: Our dance of custom round about the oak

speaker: MISTRESS QUICKLY
text_entry: Of Herne the hunter, let us not forget.

speaker: SIR HUGH EVANS
text_entry: Pray you, lock hand in hand; yourselves in order set

speaker: SIR HUGH EVANS
text_entry: And twenty glow-worms shall our lanterns be,

speaker: SIR HUGH EVANS
text_entry: To guide our measure round about the tree.

speaker: SIR HUGH EVANS
text_entry: But, stay; I smell a man of middle-earth.

speaker: FALSTAFF
text_entry: Heavens defend me from that Welsh fairy, lest he

speaker: FALSTAFF
text_entry: transform me to a piece of cheese!

speaker: PISTOL
text_entry: Vile worm, thou wast o'erlook'd even in thy birth.

speaker: MISTRESS QUICKLY
text_entry: With trial-fire touch me his finger-end:

speaker: MISTRESS QUICKLY
text_entry: If he be chaste, the flame will back descend

speaker: MISTRESS QUICKLY
text_entry: And turn him to no pain; but if he start,

speaker: MISTRESS QUICKLY
text_entry: It is the flesh of a corrupted heart.

speaker: PISTOL
text_entry: A trial, come.

speaker: SIR HUGH EVANS
text_entry: Come, will this wood take fire?

speaker: SIR HUGH EVANS
text_entry: They burn him with their tapers

speaker: FALSTAFF
text_entry: Oh, Oh, Oh!

speaker: MISTRESS QUICKLY
text_entry: Corrupt, corrupt, and tainted in desire!

speaker: MISTRESS QUICKLY
text_entry: About him, fairies; sing a scornful rhyme;

speaker: MISTRESS QUICKLY
text_entry: And, as you trip, still pinch him to your time.

speaker: MISTRESS QUICKLY
text_entry: SONG.

speaker: MISTRESS QUICKLY
text_entry: Fie on sinful fantasy!

speaker: MISTRESS QUICKLY
text_entry: Fie on lust and luxury!

speaker: MISTRESS QUICKLY
text_entry: Lust is but a bloody fire,

speaker: MISTRESS QUICKLY
text_entry: Kindled with unchaste desire,

speaker: MISTRESS QUICKLY
text_entry: Fed in heart, whose flames aspire

speaker: MISTRESS QUICKLY
text_entry: As thoughts do blow them, higher and higher.

speaker: MISTRESS QUICKLY
text_entry: Pinch him, fairies, mutually;

speaker: MISTRESS QUICKLY
text_entry: Pinch him for his villany;

speaker: MISTRESS QUICKLY
text_entry: Pinch him, and burn him, and turn him about,

speaker: MISTRESS QUICKLY
text_entry: Till candles and starlight and moonshine be out.

speaker: MISTRESS QUICKLY
text_entry: During this song they pinch FALSTAFF. DOCTOR CAIUS  comes one way, and steals away a boy in green;  SLENDER another way, and takes off a boy in white;  and FENTON comes and steals away ANN PAGE.  A noise of hunting is heard within. All the  Fairies run away. FALSTAFF pulls off his buck's head, and rises

speaker: MISTRESS QUICKLY
text_entry: Enter PAGE, FORD, MISTRESS PAGE, and MISTRESS FORD

speaker: PAGE
text_entry: Nay, do not fly; I think we have watch'd you now

speaker: PAGE
text_entry: Will none but Herne the hunter serve your turn?

speaker: MISTRESS PAGE
text_entry: I pray you, come, hold up the jest no higher

speaker: MISTRESS PAGE
text_entry: Now, good Sir John, how like you Windsor wives?

speaker: MISTRESS PAGE
text_entry: See you these, husband? do not these fair yokes

speaker: MISTRESS PAGE
text_entry: Become the forest better than the town?

speaker: FORD
text_entry: Now, sir, who's a cuckold now? Master Brook,

speaker: FORD
text_entry: Falstaff's a knave, a cuckoldly knave; here are his

speaker: FORD
text_entry: horns, Master Brook: and, Master Brook, he hath

speaker: FORD
text_entry: enjoyed nothing of Ford's but his buck-basket, his

speaker: FORD
text_entry: cudgel, and twenty pounds of money, which must be

speaker: FORD
text_entry: paid to Master Brook; his horses are arrested for

speaker: FORD
text_entry: it, Master Brook.

speaker: MISTRESS FORD
text_entry: Sir John, we have had ill luck; we could never meet.

speaker: MISTRESS FORD
text_entry: I will never take you for my love again; but I will

speaker: MISTRESS FORD
text_entry: always count you my deer.

speaker: FALSTAFF
text_entry: I do begin to perceive that I am made an ass.

speaker: FORD
text_entry: Ay, and an ox too: both the proofs are extant.

speaker: FALSTAFF
text_entry: And these are not fairies? I was three or four

speaker: FALSTAFF
text_entry: times in the thought they were not fairies: and yet

speaker: FALSTAFF
text_entry: the guiltiness of my mind, the sudden surprise of my

speaker: FALSTAFF
text_entry: powers, drove the grossness of the foppery into a

speaker: FALSTAFF
text_entry: received belief, in despite of the teeth of all

speaker: FALSTAFF
text_entry: rhyme and reason, that they were fairies. See now

speaker: FALSTAFF
text_entry: how wit may be made a Jack-a-Lent, when 'tis upon

speaker: FALSTAFF
text_entry: ill employment!

speaker: SIR HUGH EVANS
text_entry: Sir John Falstaff, serve Got, and leave your

speaker: SIR HUGH EVANS
text_entry: desires, and fairies will not pinse you.

speaker: FORD
text_entry: Well said, fairy Hugh.

speaker: SIR HUGH EVANS
text_entry: And leave your jealousies too, I pray you.

speaker: FORD
text_entry: I will never mistrust my wife again till thou art

speaker: FORD
text_entry: able to woo her in good English.

speaker: FALSTAFF
text_entry: Have I laid my brain in the sun and dried it, that

speaker: FALSTAFF
text_entry: it wants matter to prevent so gross o'erreaching as

speaker: FALSTAFF
text_entry: this? Am I ridden with a Welsh goat too? shall I

speaker: FALSTAFF
text_entry: have a coxcomb of frize? 'Tis time I were choked

speaker: FALSTAFF
text_entry: with a piece of toasted cheese.

speaker: SIR HUGH EVANS
text_entry: Seese is not good to give putter; your belly is all putter.

speaker: FALSTAFF
text_entry: 'Seese' and 'putter'! have I lived to stand at the

speaker: FALSTAFF
text_entry: taunt of one that makes fritters of English? This

speaker: FALSTAFF
text_entry: is enough to be the decay of lust and late-walking

speaker: FALSTAFF
text_entry: through the realm.

speaker: MISTRESS PAGE
text_entry: Why Sir John, do you think, though we would have the

speaker: MISTRESS PAGE
text_entry: virtue out of our hearts by the head and shoulders

speaker: MISTRESS PAGE
text_entry: and have given ourselves without scruple to hell,

speaker: MISTRESS PAGE
text_entry: that ever the devil could have made you our delight?

speaker: FORD
text_entry: What, a hodge-pudding? a bag of flax?

speaker: MISTRESS PAGE
text_entry: A puffed man?

speaker: PAGE
text_entry: Old, cold, withered and of intolerable entrails?

speaker: FORD
text_entry: And one that is as slanderous as Satan?

speaker: PAGE
text_entry: And as poor as Job?

speaker: FORD
text_entry: And as wicked as his wife?

speaker: SIR HUGH EVANS
text_entry: And given to fornications, and to taverns and sack

speaker: SIR HUGH EVANS
text_entry: and wine and metheglins, and to drinkings and

speaker: SIR HUGH EVANS
text_entry: swearings and starings, pribbles and prabbles?

speaker: FALSTAFF
text_entry: Well, I am your theme: you have the start of me; I

speaker: FALSTAFF
text_entry: am dejected; I am not able to answer the Welsh

speaker: FALSTAFF
text_entry: flannel; ignorance itself is a plummet o'er me: use

speaker: FALSTAFF
text_entry: me as you will.

speaker: FORD
text_entry: Marry, sir, we'll bring you to Windsor, to one

speaker: FORD
text_entry: Master Brook, that you have cozened of money, to

speaker: FORD
text_entry: whom you should have been a pander: over and above

speaker: FORD
text_entry: that you have suffered, I think to repay that money

speaker: FORD
text_entry: will be a biting affliction.

speaker: PAGE
text_entry: Yet be cheerful, knight: thou shalt eat a posset

speaker: PAGE
text_entry: to-night at my house; where I will desire thee to

speaker: PAGE
text_entry: laugh at my wife, that now laughs at thee: tell her

speaker: PAGE
text_entry: Master Slender hath married her daughter.

speaker: MISTRESS PAGE
text_entry: [Aside]  Doctors doubt that: if Anne Page be my

speaker: MISTRESS PAGE
text_entry: daughter, she is, by this, Doctor Caius' wife.

speaker: MISTRESS PAGE
text_entry: Enter SLENDER

speaker: SLENDER
text_entry: Whoa ho! ho, father Page!

speaker: PAGE
text_entry: Son, how now! how now, son! have you dispatched?

speaker: SLENDER
text_entry: Dispatched! I'll make the best in Gloucestershire

speaker: SLENDER
text_entry: know on't; would I were hanged, la, else.

speaker: PAGE
text_entry: Of what, son?

speaker: SLENDER
text_entry: I came yonder at Eton to marry Mistress Anne Page,

speaker: SLENDER
text_entry: and she's a great lubberly boy. If it had not been

speaker: SLENDER
text_entry: i' the church, I would have swinged him, or he

speaker: SLENDER
text_entry: should have swinged me. If I did not think it had

speaker: SLENDER
text_entry: been Anne Page, would I might never stir!--and 'tis

speaker: SLENDER
text_entry: a postmaster's boy.

speaker: PAGE
text_entry: Upon my life, then, you took the wrong.

speaker: SLENDER
text_entry: What need you tell me that? I think so, when I took

speaker: SLENDER
text_entry: a boy for a girl. If I had been married to him, for

speaker: SLENDER
text_entry: all he was in woman's apparel, I would not have had

speaker: SLENDER
text_entry: him.

speaker: PAGE
text_entry: Why, this is your own folly. Did not I tell you how

speaker: PAGE
text_entry: you should know my daughter by her garments?

speaker: SLENDER
text_entry: I went to her in white, and cried 'mum,' and she

speaker: SLENDER
text_entry: cried 'budget,' as Anne and I had appointed; and yet

speaker: SLENDER
text_entry: it was not Anne, but a postmaster's boy.

speaker: MISTRESS PAGE
text_entry: Good George, be not angry: I knew of your purpose;

speaker: MISTRESS PAGE
text_entry: turned my daughter into green; and, indeed, she is

speaker: MISTRESS PAGE
text_entry: now with the doctor at the deanery, and there married.

speaker: MISTRESS PAGE
text_entry: Enter DOCTOR CAIUS

speaker: DOCTOR CAIUS
text_entry: Vere is Mistress Page? By gar, I am cozened: I ha'

speaker: DOCTOR CAIUS
text_entry: married un garcon, a boy; un paysan, by gar, a boy;

speaker: DOCTOR CAIUS
text_entry: it is not Anne Page: by gar, I am cozened.

speaker: MISTRESS PAGE
text_entry: Why, did you take her in green?

speaker: DOCTOR CAIUS
text_entry: Ay, by gar, and 'tis a boy: by gar, I'll raise all Windsor.

speaker: DOCTOR CAIUS
text_entry: Exit

speaker: FORD
text_entry: This is strange. Who hath got the right Anne?

speaker: PAGE
text_entry: My heart misgives me: here comes Master Fenton.

speaker: PAGE
text_entry: Enter FENTON and ANNE PAGE

speaker: PAGE
text_entry: How now, Master Fenton!

speaker: ANNE PAGE
text_entry: Pardon, good father! good my mother, pardon!

speaker: PAGE
text_entry: Now, mistress, how chance you went not with Master Slender?

speaker: MISTRESS PAGE
text_entry: Why went you not with master doctor, maid?

speaker: FENTON
text_entry: You do amaze her: hear the truth of it.

speaker: FENTON
text_entry: You would have married her most shamefully,

speaker: FENTON
text_entry: Where there was no proportion held in love.

speaker: FENTON
text_entry: The truth is, she and I, long since contracted,

speaker: FENTON
text_entry: Are now so sure that nothing can dissolve us.

speaker: FENTON
text_entry: The offence is holy that she hath committed;

speaker: FENTON
text_entry: And this deceit loses the name of craft,

speaker: FENTON
text_entry: Of disobedience, or unduteous title,

speaker: FENTON
text_entry: Since therein she doth evitate and shun

speaker: FENTON
text_entry: A thousand irreligious cursed hours,

speaker: FENTON
text_entry: Which forced marriage would have brought upon her.

speaker: FORD
text_entry: Stand not amazed; here is no remedy:

speaker: FORD
text_entry: In love the heavens themselves do guide the state;

speaker: FORD
text_entry: Money buys lands, and wives are sold by fate.

speaker: FALSTAFF
text_entry: I am glad, though you have ta'en a special stand to

speaker: FALSTAFF
text_entry: strike at me, that your arrow hath glanced.

speaker: PAGE
text_entry: Well, what remedy? Fenton, heaven give thee joy!

speaker: PAGE
text_entry: What cannot be eschew'd must be embraced.

speaker: FALSTAFF
text_entry: When night-dogs run, all sorts of deer are chased.

speaker: MISTRESS PAGE
text_entry: Well, I will muse no further. Master Fenton,

speaker: MISTRESS PAGE
text_entry: Heaven give you many, many merry days!

speaker: MISTRESS PAGE
text_entry: Good husband, let us every one go home,

speaker: MISTRESS PAGE
text_entry: And laugh this sport o'er by a country fire;

speaker: MISTRESS PAGE
text_entry: Sir John and all.

speaker: FORD
text_entry: Let it be so. Sir John,

speaker: FORD
text_entry: To Master Brook you yet shall hold your word

speaker: FORD
text_entry: For he tonight shall lie with Mistress Ford.

speaker: FORD
text_entry: Exeunt
